thread.title: 'Worse than Brexit and Trump' - Sunderland fans react as Lee Cattermole is ruled out for four months
thread.title_full: 'Worse than Brexit and Trump' - Sunderland fans react as Lee Cattermole is ruled out for four months

author: Sean McCormick
title: 'Worse than Brexit and Trump' - Sunderland fans react as Lee Cattermole is ruled out for four months
text:
Sunderland's Lee Cattermole (Photo: Richard Sellers/PA Wire) Share Get Sunderland AFC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Just as it seemed Sunderland were getting over their injury woes, the club confirmed this afternoon that Lee Cattermole has been ruled out for four months with a hip injury. 
The midfielder had been battling back from a back injury but a torn cartilage will now see the combative midfielder ruled out for at least four months, after undergoing surgery in the USA. 
The news comes as a big blow to Sunderland boss David Moyes, who still has fellow central midfielders Jan Kirchhoff and Jack Rodwell away from full fitness, while Didier Ndong will leave the squad in January to play for Gabon in the African Cup of Nations. 
Understandably, the news has left Sunderland fans gutted on social media, as the club continue their relegation battle without their midfield general. 
Michael Trotter tweeted: “That Cattermole news is absolutely horrendous.” 
Elsewhere, A Love Supreme joked: “Anybody with a spare hip willing to sling one over to Lee Cattermole? We need him back.” 
Meanwhile, Ross Trump Jr isn’t impressed to see Cattermole on the sidelines again, labelling him ‘injury-prone’. 
He tweeted: “Never actually realised how injury prone Cattermole is. Only time he’s played 30+ league games for us was last season.” 
A few Sunderland fans have now called for the club to sign a central midfielder in the January transfer window. Read More Sunderland midfielder Lee Cattermole ruled out for minimum of four months 
Allan Davis reflected that, tweeting: “Ndong probably off to AFCON as we knew, now Catts is out till at least March. We need another midfielder on top of what we needed in January.” 
Joh Ridley agreed, urging the club to bring back Yann M’Vila on a permanent basis, as he said: “With Catts out, all the more reason to sign @yannmvilafr @SunderlandAFC don’t you think? #bringyannhome” 
Finally, Ed Wragg reflected the mood towards news of Cattermole’s injury, brilliantly suggesting: “Lee Cattermole getting injured for four months is worse than Brexit and Trump becoming President.” 
To see how Sunderland fans reacted to the latest injury blow, have a read below... Like us on Facebook
